conclusion: Analyze the relationship between acceleration and time for objects A and B using the diagram.
Graph with acceleration on vertical axis and time on horizontal axis. Lines A and B represent acceleration over time. Line A is horizontal, line B is inclined. Both start at origin.
Line A indicates constant acceleration, line B indicates changing acceleration. Time intervals t1 and t2 marked, with t2 = 2t1.
Both objects start from rest at time t = 0.
Acceleration of object A is constant.
Acceleration of object B changes over time.
t2 = 2t1, meaning time elapsed for object B is twice that of object A at time t1.
Initial velocities of both objects are zero.
Velocity of object A at time t1 is v_A = a_A × t1.
Velocity of object B at time t1 is v_B = a_B × t1.
Since t1 is the same for both objects and both start from rest, their velocities at time t1 are the same.
Final answer: Yes, the objects have the same velocity at time t1.
